Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Gordion cup; interior: reserved at top, glazed below; exterior: black bands at top and bottom of reserved handle zone; glazed below; painted inscription in handle zone.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.425, 1888,0601.427, 1888,0601.215, 1948,0815.1, 1948,08-15.2 and Cambridge, Fitzwilliam GR.206.1894. See Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., 89 and pl. 25, A17.4.
